truth: -  "Fluid dynamics is the study of how liquids and gases move."
fiction: -  "Fluid dynamics is the study of how solids and gases interact."

truth: -  "Bernoulli's principle states that an increase in the speed of a fluid occurs simultaneously with a decrease in pressure."
fiction: -  "Bernoulli's principle states that an increase in the speed of a fluid occurs simultaneously with an increase in pressure."

truth: -  "Viscosity is a measure of a fluid's resistance to flow."
fiction: -  "Viscosity is a measure of a fluid's eagerness to flow."

truth: -  "The Navier-Stokes equations describe the motion of fluid substances."
fiction: -  "The Navier-Stokes equations describe the motion of solid substances."

truth: -  "Turbulence is a complex phenomenon in fluid dynamics characterized by chaotic changes in pressure and flow velocity."
fiction: -  "Turbulence is a simple phenomenon in fluid dynamics characterized by orderly changes in pressure and flow velocity."

truth: -  "In fluid dynamics, a wake is the region of disturbed flow downstream of a solid body moving through a fluid."
fiction: -  "In fluid dynamics, a wake is the region of disturbed flow upstream of a solid body moving through a fluid."

truth: -  "Laminar flow is characterized by fluid particles following smooth paths in layers, with each layer moving smoothly past the adjacent layers."
fiction: -  "Laminar flow is characterized by fluid particles following chaotic paths in layers, with each layer colliding with the adjacent layers."

truth: -  "The Reynolds number helps predict flow patterns in different fluid flow situations."
fiction: -  "The Reynolds number helps predict color patterns in different fluid flow situations."

truth: -  "Drag is a force that acts opposite to the relative motion of any object moving with respect to a surrounding fluid."
fiction: -  "Drag is a force that acts in the same direction as the relative motion of any object moving with respect to a surrounding fluid."

truth: -  "The principle of buoyancy states that any body completely or partially submerged in a fluid at rest is acted upon by an upward force equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the body."
fiction: -  "The principle of buoyancy states that any body completely or partially submerged in a fluid at rest is acted upon by a downward force equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the body."

truth: -  "Stokes' law describes the motion of small particles in a fluid medium."
fiction: -  "Stokes' law describes the motion of large animals in a fluid medium."

truth: -  "The Magnus effect describes the curve of a spinning object moving through a fluid."
fiction: -  "The Magnus effect describes the straight path of a spinning object moving through a fluid."

truth: -  "The Venturi effect states that fluid pressure decreases as the flow speed increases within a constricted section of pipe."
fiction: -  "The Venturi effect states that fluid pressure increases as the flow speed decreases within a constricted section of pipe."

truth: -  "In fluid dynamics, flow rate is the volume of fluid which passes per unit time."
fiction: -  "In fluid dynamics, flow rate is the volume of fluid which passes per unit distance."

truth: -  "The principle of fluid continuity states that the product of the cross-sectional area of a pipe and the velocity of the fluid remains constant."
fiction: -  "The principle of fluid continuity states that the product of the cross-sectional area of a pipe and the velocity of the fluid always changes."

truth: -  "In fluid dynamics, a vortex is a region in a fluid in which the flow revolves around an axis line."
fiction: -  "In fluid dynamics, a vortex is a region in a fluid in which the flow moves in a straight line."

truth: -  "The lift force on an airplane wing is directly related to the change in speed of the airflows above and below the wing."
fiction: -  "The lift force on an airplane wing is directly related to the color of the wing."

truth: -  "The Pascal's law states that a change in pressure at any point in an enclosed fluid is transmitted undiminished to all points in the fluid."
fiction: -  "The Pascal's law states that a change in pressure at any point in an enclosed fluid is only transmitted to the nearest points in the fluid."

truth: -  "The Archimedes' principle states that the upward buoyant force exerted on a body immersed in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid that the body displaces."
fiction: -  "The Archimedes' principle states that the upward buoyant force exerted on a body immersed in a fluid is equal to the weight of the body itself."

truth: -  "The Darcy-Weisbach equation describes the frictional pressure loss along a given length of pipe for a steady flow."
fiction: -  "The Darcy-Weisbach equation describes
